channel.title: Lack fo dedication
channel.description:
Why is it that so many server owners lack any dedication to their server. I've been getting into them again recently, and every server I join anymore either has a giant ass player reset, shuts down, and/or hires the worst staff in the world.
I don't mind this at times as the flaws can typically be overlooked in most cases, it's a part of life that nothing is perfect.
But one thing pisses me off more than anything. When the server shuts down, it's typically because "I'm bored of it".
I'm just wondering as to why so few people are actually dedicated to the server and the work others put into it?

item.title: Lack fo dedication
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:6, topic:537473”]well if you’re bored of something why would you keep doing it[/quote]^ reason why I quit

Read full topic

item.title: Lack fo dedication
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

Honestly I felt down on my server dev team for two reasons

  1. Just got a ps4

  2. The Lack of communication with dev team results in uninterested in deving stuff for the server -o-

That is why I lack dedication. I feel like making some models now

Read full topic

item.title: Lack fo dedication
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:16, topic:537473”][quote author=JavaTC link=topic=656293.msg4392054#msg4392054 date=1387867042]
It’s like the stupid ‘luring is okay because it’s just pixels’ argument, there’s work behind it, even if only a few hours, not fun to loose.[/quote]If those are willing to go into somewhere they can be killed and lose their items, then they shouldn’t bring items they aren’t willing to lose. Luring can easily be avoided, it all bases on the lured. If this individual is smart enough to not trust a stranger with his ‘pixels’, then this individual would have no loss in the end. It’s called ‘pking’ for a reason, there is only one objective: To ‘player kill’ anyone by all means necessary. Now, that doesn’t mean you are open to commit DoS attacks and etc. to get the kill, everything that the game provides you for use is at your disposal. Any foreign sources of victor is simply cheating and should have set restrictions for. Luring is perfectly fine.[/quote]
All depends on the person. I personally find it quite reprehensible since loosing valuable gear because I’m willing to place trust in someone. Then again, with Runescape the way it is, all is fair in love and war.

Read full topic

item.title: Lack fo dedication
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“JavaTC, post:11, topic:537473”]It’s like the stupid ‘luring is okay because it’s just pixels’ argument, there’s work behind it, even if only a few hours, not fun to loose.[/quote]If those are willing to go into somewhere they can be killed and lose their items, then they shouldn’t bring items they aren’t willing to lose. Luring can easily be avoided, it all bases on the lured. If this individual is smart enough to not trust a stranger with his ‘pixels’, then this individual would have no loss in the end. It’s called ‘pking’ for a reason, there is only one objective: To ‘player kill’ anyone by all means necessary. Now, that doesn’t mean you are open to commit DoS attacks and etc. to get the kill, everything that the game provides you for use is at your disposal. Any foreign sources of victor is simply cheating and should have set restrictions for. Luring is perfectly fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Lack fo dedication
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

nolan2131:

They don’t know what they’re getting themselves into. They look at the glamor from the players prospective, not knowing what goes on behind the scenes and the work it takes to maintain. I feel that people usually get in over their head in these situations.

More than likely.

Read full topic

item.title: Lack fo dedication
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

because at some point you learn stealing other peoples work just isn’t worth the time and effort?

lolz

asshole_rule:

well if you’re bored of something why would you keep doing it

Because people put work into it. I just find it quite odd how they’re willing to throw a few hundred people’s/characters work away simply because they’re bored of development. It’s like the stupid ‘luring is okay because it’s just pixels’ argument, there’s work behind it, even if only a few hours, not fun to loose.

Flame_:

Most servers fail due to the person running it becoming intimidated by the workload. People enjoy that aspect of having the beloved golden crown and unrestricted abilities. Yet once it comes down to the responsibility of maintaining the server’s demands and upkeep, they back off and ultimately lead the game to its downfall.

I suppose it’s expected of a community full of 14 year olds that use half-assed copyrighted material

RiiPiiNFtW:

Runescape Private Servers are only interesting for so long. Once you get into other things, its more fun to do those other things. RSPS’s are the same thing, theres almost no variety or uniqueness to them. Right your own game or something. Its more educational than stolen code.

True. Though private servers are typically a better start than literally jumping into your own game.

Si Force:

As Flame said, it’s along the lines of server owners not being prepared for the challenge that is running a server. They enjoy the privileges that they bestow upon themselves, however a lot of them generally tend to lose interest in maintaining and updating the back-end of the server. It takes a lot of work to run a successful server, and some of those people are either lazy or not mature enough to do it.

I’d say maturity has more to do with it quite honestly since dedication typically comes with age as your discover your talents. I just wish some of them would at least practice dedication of some kind rather than just drop the whole thing all together, seems like a bit of a waste.

Read full topic
